ygData.msgSnippet: It is a shortcoming of the WebUI (that was intentional at the time). There is a dirty fix to it by editing the Processors.options file and having several

Subject: RE: Filters vs. DecideRules Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Release 1.10.0 pending
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=163406187; y=m1dNZtO5tp0k0QPO0WS11h_fIGQnvWpRgeZBR9OrGg7CoUy3
X-Yahoo-Profile: kristsi25

It is a shortcoming of the WebUI (that was intentional at the time). There
is a dirty fix to it by editing the Processors.options file and having
several entries for the writer under different 'names'. Basically each
processor (just like the filters) needs a unique name. For the filters the
user provides the name. For the processors the name is provided in the
Processor.options file and must be unique within each processing chain. The
fact that it need only be unique within each processing chain does actually
lead to another possible dirty fix if you only need 2 instances. You could
set it up like so:

Extractor Chain
<Extractor Processors>
<1st Writer Processor>

Writing Chain
<2nd Writer Processor>

You could even do something like (although there may be 'gotcha's' to this
that I'm not seeing):

Fetch Chain
<Fetch Processors>
<Extractor Processors>
<1st Writer Processor>

Extractor Chain
<2nd Writer Processor>

Writing Chain
<3rd Writer Processor>

The third possible fix (and perhaps the easiest if it works) would be to
hand craft the order.xml. Just copy the WriterProcessor entry and make sure
to change its name. I'm not sure if that'll work, it may be that the
Processor.options file is used to verify the processor names, but I don't
think so.

- Kris 

> -----Original Message-----
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of pandae667
> Sent: 7. september 2006 07:29
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Filters vs. DecideRules Re: [archive-crawler] Re: 
> Release 1.10.0 pending
> 
> Hi Michael,
> 
> >> One thing that came to my mind while testing - is there a 
> way to add 
> >> multiple ARCWriters to Heritrix, each with a seperate set of 
> >> DecideRules/Filters so I can pre-categorize my data easily?
> 
> > Should be no problem adding multiple writers, each with its own rule
> set.
> 
> I think there is a problem about doing it - the webUI simply 
> doesn't allow me to do it. It just allows me to add one 
> writer of each type, adding multiple writers of the same type 
> is not possible.
> 
> This is why I happened to ask. I were unsure if this 
> limitation is intentional - or just a shortcoming of the webUI.
> 
> So I'll try if it breaks anything if I add them manually to 
> the order.xml (and it would be nice for sure if a post 1.10 
> version of Heritrix would allow me to do it via the webUI, too)
> 
> 
> 
>  
>
